title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 28.2 - Designation of public benefit corporations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 28.2 - Designation of public benefit corporations

State Regulations

Pursuant to Banking Law, section 103(1)(c), the Banking Board
hereby designates the New York State Housing Finance Agency and the

Metropolitan Transportation Authority, as public benefit corporations to which
any bank or trust company may make loans equal but not exceeding 25 percent of
the capital stock, surplus fund and undivided profits of such bank or trust
company. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
28.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
